1.name: The Werewolf
1.description: Two scientists come across an auto accident and find an unconscious man in the wreck. They take him back to their lab and inject him with a serum they have been working with. Unfortunately,...                See full summary »

2.name: Forbidden Planet
2.description: A starship crew goes to investigate the silence of a planet's colony only to find two survivors and a deadly secret that one of them has.

3.name: High Society
3.description: A spoiled heiress must choose between three suitors: her jazz musician ex-husband, a stuffy businessman, and an undercover tabloid reporter.

4.name: The Searchers
4.description: An American Civil War veteran embarks on a journey to rescue his niece from the Comanches.

5.name: The Ten Commandments
5.description: The Egyptian Prince, Moses, learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.

6.name: Giant
6.description: Sprawling epic covering the life of a Texas cattle rancher and his family and associates.

7.name: The King and I
7.description: A widow accepts a job as a live-in governess to the King of Siam's children.

8.name: Moby Dick
8.description: The sole survivor of a lost whaling ship relates the tale of his captain's self-destructive obsession to hunt the white whale, Moby Dick.

9.name: The Killing
9.description: Crooks plan and execute a daring race-track robbery.

10.name: Around the World in 80 Days
10.description: A Victorian Englishman bets that with the new steamships and railways he can circumnavigate the globe in eighty days.

11.name: The Man Who Knew Too Much
11.description: An American physician and his wife take matters into their own hands after assassins planning to execute a foreign Prime Minister kidnap their son.

12.name: Lust for Life
12.description: The life of brilliant but tortured artist Vincent van Gogh.

13.name: War and Peace
13.description: Napoleon's (Herbert Lom's) tumultuous relations with Russia including his disastrous 1812 invasion serve as the backdrop for the tangled personal lives of two aristocratic families.

14.name: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
14.description: A small-town doctor learns that the population of his community is being replaced by emotionless alien duplicates.

15.name: Carousel
15.description: Fifteen years after his death, a carousel barker is granted permission to return to Earth for one day to make amends to his widow and their daughter.

16.name: The Bad Seed
16.description: A housewife suspects that her seemingly perfect eight year-old daughter is a heartless killer.

17.name: The Last Wagon
17.description: Wagon train survivors of an Apache attack entrust the sheriff's prisoner, scout Comanche Todd, with their lives despite his wanted-for-murder status.

18.name: The Conqueror
18.description: Mongol chief Temujin battles against Tartar armies and for the love of the Tartar princess Bortai. Temujin becomes the emperor Genghis Khan.

19.name: Picnic
19.description: Emotions are ignited amongst the complacent townsfolk when a handsome drifter arrives in a small Kansas community on the morning of the Labour Day picnic.

20.name: The Baby and the Battleship
20.description: After a pierside mix-up with the Italian family of his fiancée, Able Seaman Knocker White finds himself literally left holding the baby. Unable to return it before his ship sails, he ...                See full summary »

21.name: Baby Doll
21.description: A steamy tale of two Southern rivals and a sensuous nineteen-year-old virgin.

22.name: Written on the Wind
22.description: Alcoholic playboy Kyle Hadley marries the woman secretly loved by his poor but hard-working best friend, who in turn is pursued by Kyle's nymphomaniac sister.

23.name: It Conquered the World
23.description: A well meaning scientist guides an alien monster to Earth from Venus, so that he can rid mankind of feelings and emotions - but only death and sorrow results.

24.name: Somebody Up There Likes Me
24.description: Boxer Rocky Graziano's biopic, based on his autobiography, from childhood to his World Middleweight Championship title win at age 28 in 1947.

25.name: Earth vs. the Flying Saucers
25.description: Extraterrestrials traveling in high-tech flying saucers contact a scientist as part of a plan to enslave the inhabitants of Earth.

26.name: Et Dieu... créa la femme
26.description: In sunny St. Tropez, a young sexpot loves one brother but marries the other.

27.name: The Wrong Man
27.description: In 1953, an innocent man named Christopher Emmanuel "Manny" Balestrero is arrested after being mistaken for an armed robber.

28.name: Anastasia
28.description: An opportunistic Russian businessman tries to pass a mysterious impostor as the Grand Duchess Anastasia. But she is so convincing in her performance that even the biggest skeptics believe her.

29.description: In a totalitarian future society, Winston Smith, whose daily work is re-writing history, tries to rebel by falling in love.

30.name: Bus Stop
30.description: A naive but stubborn cowboy falls in love with a saloon singer and tries to take her away against her will to get married and live on his ranch in Montana.

31.name: Friendly Persuasion
31.description: The pacifist attitude of a Quaker family is tested as a result of the American Civil War.

32.name: Notre-Dame de Paris
32.description: The timeless tale of the seductive gypsy Esmeralda and the tortured hunchback Quasimodo.

33.name: Un condamné à mort s'est échappé ou Le vent souffle où il veut
33.description: A captured French Resistance fighter during WWII engineers a daunting escape from a Nazi prison in France.

34.name: The Harder They Fall
34.description: Down-on-his-luck ex-sportswriter Eddie Willis is hired by shady fight promoter Nick Benko to promote his latest find, an unknown but easily exploitable phenom from Argentina.

35.name: The Black Sleep
35.description: Sir Joel Cadman, a mad scientist, kidnaps his victims and cuts open their brains in an effort to discover a means to cure his wife's brain tumor.

36.name: A Kiss Before Dying
36.description: A ruthless college student resorts to murder in a futile attempt to marry an heiress.

37.name: Rebel in Town
37.description: After the Civil War, in a Yankee town five Confederates find trouble when one of them accidentally shoots a local young boy.

38.name: World Without End
38.description: Astronauts returning from a voyage to Mars are caught in a time warp and are propelled into a post-Apocalyptic Earth populated by mutants.

39.name: Love Me Tender
39.description: At the end of the Civil War, a Confederate team is ordered to rob a Union payroll train but the war ends leaving these men with their Union loot, until the Feds come looking for it.

40.name: While the City Sleeps
40.description: A serial killer has been killing beautiful women in New York, and the new owner of a media company offers a high ranking job to the 1st administrator who can get the earliest scoops on the case.

41.name: Godzilla, King of the Monsters!
41.description: A 400-foot (122-meter) dinosaur-like beast, awoken from undersea hibernation off the Japanese coast by atomic-bomb testing, attacks Tokyo.

42.name: Patterns
42.description: When Fred Staples is recruited onto the board of a high-powered New York corporation, he finds his ethics and ambition at odds.

43.name: Aparajito
43.description: Following his father's death, a boy leaves home to study in Calcutta, while his mother must face a life alone.

44.name: The First Traveling Saleslady
44.description: At the turn of the century, Rose and ex-showbiz friend Molly get involved in selling steel. When they come unstuck with corsets, they embark on the even more hazardous project of selling ...                See full summary »

45.name: The Scarlet Hour
45.description: An unhappy wife uses her powers of manipulation to draw an infatuated man into an ill-fated jewelry heist.

46.name: Trapeze
46.description: A crippled circus acrobat is torn emotionally between two ambitious young trapeze artists, one a talented young American and a less-gifted but beautiful Italian.

47.name: Reach for the Sky
47.description: Biopic of RAF Group Captain Douglas Bader who, after having lost both legs, flew a British fighter plane during WW2.

48.name: The Swan
48.description: Princess Beatrice's days of enjoying the regal life are numbered unless her only daughter, Princess Alexandra, makes a good impression on a distant cousin when he pays a surprise visit to ...                See full summary »

49.name: Jubal
49.description: A new foreman rejects the sexual advances of a frustrated rancher's wife, which leads to conflicts that could get him killed.

50.name: Nightfall
50.description: Through a series of bizarre coincidences, an artist finds himself falsely accused of bank robbery and murder and is pursued by the authorities and the real killers.
